snippet: Marc Cenedella, a wealthy businessman, who was laying the groundwork for a run in New York, faced criticism over a blog with entries on sex, women and drugs.
abstract: Marc Cenedella, a wealthy Republican businessman who was laying the groundwork for a US Senate campaign in New York to take on first-term Democrat Kirsten E Gillibrand, announces that he will not run; revelations that Cendellla had a blog under his name containing questionable entries about women, sex and drugs brought harsh criticism, particularly from women's groups; Cendella accuses Gillibrand of being behind the news report about the blog entries.
lead_paragraph: Marc Cenedella, a wealthy businessman, who was laying the groundwork for a run in New York, faced criticism over a blog with entries on sex, women and drugs.

headline.seo: Marc Cenedella, Republican Criticized Over Blog, Decides Against Senate Run
headline.main: Republican Chided Over Blog Says He Won’t Run for Senate
headline.print_headline: Republican Chided Over Blog Says He Won’t Run for Senate
